data.title: Long Term Employee
data.text: In addition to combination platters and pints/quarts for carry out, half and full sized trays are also available!  Preordering is recommended.  These were packaged today--shrimp fried rice, sweet and sour chicken (sauce on the side), and pepper steak.

data.title: Loyal customer  approx 25 Years
data.text: Love going her Chi knows everyone's name and greets you as you walk in . The food is always hot and plentiful. Ya the only Chinese food I will eat . The only place I know that's had been sprout egg rolls instead of nasty cabbage . The portion sizes could feed 3 so when your hungry later have now fear there are leftovers .

data.title: Lovely atmosphere, grand portions
data.text: Don't let the exterior appearance deter you.  It is housed inside an older building, but the interior is nicely decorated.  The staff was incredibly friendly, accommodating and inviting. Our group is mostly vegetarian/vegan with a couple of food sensitivities and or server understood very well our concerns.  The portions are enormous.  The side order of vegetable fried rice has a great variety of vegetables and is enough for a meal.  The pad Thai arrives heaped on a small platter and we would recommend splitting (possibly enough for 3).

data.title: THE NEW HONG KONG ROCKS
data.text: This restaurant has very fresh and not oily food. The price very reasonable, if you had a large family there would be no worries of cost.  And there will plenty food to take home as well.

data.title: Hope you like bean sprouts
data.text: The won ton soup was loaded with bean sprouts.  Had to eat a lot of them to get to the soup, but i did like it. I had the general tso chicken. The portion was large enough for 3 adults to eat. The chicken was resting on a large hand full of bean sprouts,  luckily I really like them. It was pretty good, some of the pieces were mostly breading but most were meaty. All in all very good.

data.title: Chinese food
data.text: Has great food for the money. Is a nice place to eat .has good soups. Can bring kids too.I like the almond chicken

data.title: Great Chinese Food
data.text: The servings are very large for one person.  We usually split an order and add an extra soup.  Of course you can always have a take home. My favorite is the shrimp egg foo young. The server are friendly and so is the manager.

data.title: Amazing!!!
data.text: This is my go to place for Chinese food! The portions here are unreal! Love the sweet and sour chicken and the general tso chicken!!!

data.title: Get carryout
data.text: once a week I get takeout food is ready quick service is prompt and the portions are big for the price

data.title: the best chinese food
data.text:
This is hands down the best chinese restaurant in the area. all of the staples are done perfect every time. I"m not a huge fan of fried breaded meat all the time, and they substitute for unbreaded chicken with no fuss at all.

The service is always very friendly.

data.title: Best Chinese
data.text: We have traveled to various states and had Chinese food from a lot of restaurants. None of them have lived up to quality of food that we have gotten here. Just there yesterday 12-14-2015 and while talking with the manager found out that they have many vegetarian and vegan dishes.

data.title: After church
data.text: I love their egg drop soup! I was shaking pepper in my egg drop soup and dropped the whole pepper shaker in the soup and "splash"!  I had egg drop soup all over my black shirt and skirt. The owner came over and offered me some more soup and a wet nap. Lol.

data.title: Too much food is a good thing
data.text: Family comes to town and we need plenty of food to go around. We will order three dinners and that will feed 8-10 people. They're food is good and the owner is the friendliest person I know. Great place!

data.title: AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL
data.text: This was a waste of money, when I bought the food I was surprised how much food I had but when I tasted It I see why they gave the food away, I also found bones in my chicken. Horrible experience I would rather eat prison food

data.title: Great food at great price.
data.text: Food is great and price is cheap. Me and my wife share an order of sweet and sour chicken and have leftovers. The owner talks to us about our kids and remembers us.

data.title: One of my favorite chinese restaurants, special orders are okay
data.text: Dine in or carry out this place offers good and generously portioned food and is more than willing to take special requests to add or omit items or use one sauce over another in dishes.  They aim to please and the owner is very friendly.  They offer a variety of dishes inclusing some not of the menu so look for the special board and if you want something you don't see just ask them.  They have a noodle dish that reminds us of Thai food which is very good.  If you go in a group, consider one dish for every two people and you still will likely have left overs.  We sometimes get one meal and order an extra soup and egg roll so we can split the dish and sometimes there's enough for1-2 lunches in our take home.  They use fresh pineapple.  My sister from out of state wants to visit here for one of her meals "back home" on every visit.  I've brought friends, coworkers, and dates here and my guests have always commented that they like the place.  I sometimes get carry out from here besided dining in.  I have not encountered any of the issues others reported and looking at the dates many of those comments are old.  My family and I have gone here for many years.

data.title: Hit the spot
data.text: We were all starving the afternoon after the wedding. There was plenty of food it was hot it just was not seasoned they way I am use to. I frequent the Chinese chains back home in Florida they seem to have more flavor. Over all it was still good. It hit the spot.

data.title: Soo good!
data.text: We ordered a combo plate that had sweet&sour chicken and woo dip harr. Which is smoked bacon wrapped around shrimp battered and deep fried served with sweet&sour sauce it cost $10.90 me and my friend split it and we still took home left overs . The food was so good! The woo dip hard is a must try dish!

data.title: Good Food and Service!
data.text: Last night my fiancee and I stopped in after a recommendation from a sales girl in the Mall. We were not disappointed!! Food was very tasty and service was very good!! I had the lemon chicken. and my guy ordered the Woo Dip Harr......shrimp wrapped in bacon,battered, fried and served with fried onions in a tasty sauce!! SOOO YUMMY!! And the portions are HUGE!! I have leftovers for today's lunch! Will definitely go there again and also for carryout!!

data.title: We use to love this place
data.text: Dirty cups,dirty silverware, found a caterpillar? In my broccoli dish. Management laughed said" these thing happen ,we make you new order".The blond waitress is lazy, forgetful and rude! To worried about going out back for her smoke break to take care of her table. The young dark hair waitress is wonderful though. We won't be returning to New Hong again!
